sentences.en: (= it is likely that ) you’ll be fine.
sentences.cn: 你会没事的。

sentences.en: At least they have a real chance to find work.
sentences.cn: 至少他们的确有找到工作的机会。

sentences.en: Chances are (= it is likely that ) you’ll be fine.
sentences.cn: 你会没事的。

sentences.en: He doesn't stand a ghost of a chance of selling the house.
sentences.cn: 那房子他根本不可能卖得出去。

sentences.en: He has probably said goodbye to his last chance of Olympic gold.
sentences.cn: 他可能已经失去了夺取奥运会金牌的最后机会。

sentences.en: He was grateful for a chance to relax and collect his thoughts.
sentences.cn: 他很庆幸有机会放松放松，整理一下自己的思绪。

sentences.en: Her independence and maverick behaviour precluded any chance of promotion.
sentences.cn: 她的独立精神和自行其是断送了一切升迁的机会。

sentences.en: his rivals don't stand a chance.
sentences.cn: 他的对手毫无成功的希望。

sentences.en: I seized the chance to interview Chris Hani about this issue.
sentences.cn: 我抓住机会就这一问题采访了克里斯·哈尼。

sentences.en: I wasn’t sure if I’d got quite enough petrol to get me home, but I decided to chance it .
sentences.cn: 我不知道开车回家汽油够不够，但我决定冒险一试。

sentences.en: If cancers are spotted early, there's a high chance of survival.
sentences.cn: 如果癌症在早期发现的话，存活的几率会很高。

sentences.en: If someone invited me over to Florida, I’d jump at the chance (= use the opportunity eagerly ) .
sentences.cn: 如果有人邀请我去佛罗里达，我会赶紧抓住这个机会。

sentences.en: If we did move to London, I’d stand a much better chance (= have a much better chance ) of getting a job.
sentences.cn: 如果我们真的搬到伦敦去，我找到工作的机会就大多了。

sentences.en: In general, incumbents have a 94 per cent chance of being reelected.
sentences.cn: 通常现任官员有94%的几率会再次当选。

sentences.en: Is he, by chance, her brother?
sentences.cn: 他可能是她哥哥吗?

sentences.en: It chanced that we both went to Paris that year.
sentences.cn: 碰巧那一年我们俩都去了巴黎。

sentences.en: People have been waiting impatiently for a chance to improve the situation.
sentences.cn: 人们一直在焦急地等待使形势出现转机的机会。

sentences.en: She’d never played before, but she was ready to chance her arm (= take a risk by doing something which may fail ) .
sentences.cn: 她以前从未玩过，但她准备冒险试一下。

sentences.en: There is a chance of sunny spells in the West.
sentences.cn: 西部可能会有一段天气晴朗的日子。

sentences.en: There is little chance of her being found alive.
sentences.cn: 她生还的可能性很小。

sentences.en: There’s always the chance that something will go wrong.
sentences.cn: 总有可能会出现问题。

sentences.en: They had met by chance at university and finished up getting married.
sentences.cn: 他们在大学偶遇，最后结了婚。

sentences.en: They have a more than even chance of winning the next election.
sentences.cn: 他们赢得下届选举的机会在五成以上。

sentences.en: They met by chance on a plane.
sentences.cn: 他们在飞机上不期而遇

sentences.en: We decided not to chance our luck in the storm.
sentences.cn: 我们决定不去冒险顶着暴风雨出去。

sentences.en: We took a chance and we've won. It's very gratifying.
sentences.cn: 我们决定搏上一搏，结果赢了，真是令人心花怒放。

sentences.en: were you looking for me by any chance?.
sentences.cn: 你有可能是在找我吗？。

sentences.en: Whenever I get the chance I go to Maxim's for dinner.
sentences.cn: 我一有机会便去马克西姆餐厅吃饭。

sentences.en: While in Paris we chanced on two old friends.
sentences.cn: 在巴黎我们偶然碰到两位老朋友

sentences.en: Williams knew that she had missed her chance of victory.
sentences.cn: 威廉姆斯知道她已经失掉了夺取胜利的机会。

words.tran_cn: 不确实的；偶然发生的；不安的

phrases.tran_cn: 极有限的一点机会[常用于否定句]
万一，也许（用于试探性的询问或提议）
偶然找到，偶然遇到；偶然碰到

phrases.phrase: chance would be a fine thing
phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)成功固然好，只惜良机少
经过努力奋斗才能获得成功的机会
机会对策；靠技巧取胜的游戏
不容易有的机会；极小的可能性
万一发生：抱着微小的希望或可能性
极小的可能性，不大可能的机会

trans.tran_en: the possibility that something will happen, especially something you want
to do something that you know involves a risk
